intro: Lobelia keilhackii, commonly known as the Keilhack's lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, Lobelia keilhackii is considered a rare and endangered species.
